author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great things come in small packages
review: I bought this at Legoland Germany yesterday and I really like it. It's identical to the Green Xpod, except for the missing combined Model instructions. I really like the fact, that you can do really much with those small sets. If you just add a Minifig you can even build hoverbikes or other small minifig-sized creations.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Grease
review: I don't know why i put in such a dumb title. It is  a good set, though. This is my 2nd Favorite X-POD. THis is one promotianal set that i like. I gavie it a 9 because at the end of the instructions, there were no instructions to combime it with other sets.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Black X-Pod
review: I got this fancy lil set in the mail and took it to work with me the same day. I built it while at work and it is, hands down, a nifty set. Full of interesting pieces and the colors are good. I suggest you go out and get this.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: a cool addition, and best colored x-pod
review: I got this just for the black x-pod top and bottom things for a project. The black ones look awesome with the new x-pods. If you would want more reviews look at the green x pod. they are the same set, different colors.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Very cool
review: I like these x-pods, I find them fun to build with, and they all have a great assortment of pieces in them. I especially like this one. Yes, it is the same as the green pod, but I thinks it's a lot better, because robots are black, not green. I've had this fora while now, and just today, I was bored, so I decided to build with it. The end result was an awesome robot that uses all of the pieces (except for the pod). Worth the $3.50 that you pay for it.

author: reidak49
title: robot rebel ranch
review: i got this set at a flea market and got this set it has different types my favorite robot here is the rolling one and these robots are movable but all of my sets never last long when im bord i use the set for spare parts

author: Gus_263
title: Nice building for small robot sets
review: This set is one of the small sets released with their pods, in 2004. The Black Robot pod have some small pieces that are few, but much useful. Also including the pod, this set is more to create mini robots or use their pieces to increase other sets. The small robots are easy to build and the playability, like the size, is basic, like more the playabilty of a minifigure, good to play with. In comparison with some other small sets of robots and pods, this change no much except for few pieces and of course, building and colors. With a basic building and good playability for the size, this set still a nice small set.

author: Quirrelthesquirrel
title: Ooh! Scary!
review:
I bought this set the other day and its great. It is very similar to the 4346 Robo Pod, but I like the colours on this one better. It was also only released for Halloween for a short amount of time in 2003.

You can build a shooting robot with a blaster and posable limbs, a storage robot with posable eye stalks and the sets container for its body (Can store spare pieces), or a flying robot with weapons and posable head.

Compared to later X-Pod's, it's a bit basic, but you get alot of fun out of it. The movable components make it even more enjoyable when combined with 4346 Robo Pod, or even combining it with 4347, 4348, 4349 makes a lot of creating fun!

 

Bye :D
